text: Jim Lampley (born April 8, 1949) is an American sportscaster, news anchor, movie producer, and restaurant owner. Lampley has covered 14 Olympic Games on U.S. television. Lampley has announced Major League Baseball, the Indianapolis 500, college basketball, United States Football League, Super Bowl XIX, and boxing. He has earned three Emmy awards. ==Olympic Coverage== *1976 Winter Olympics (play-by-play for ABC) *1976 Summer Olympics (play-by-play for ABC) *1980 Winter Olympics (play-by-play for ABC) *1984 Winter Olympics (daytime host for ABC) *1984 Summer Olympics (late-night host for ABC) *1992 Winter Olympics (coverage for KCBS-TV) *1992 Summer Olympics (late-night host for NBC) *1996 Summer Olympics (late-night host for NBC) *1998 Winter Olympics (primetime host for TNT) *2000 Summer Olympics (cable host for MSNBC) *2002 Winter Olympics (cable host for both MSNBC and CNBC) *2004 Summer Olympics (daytime host for NBC and cable host for USA Network) *2006 Winter Olympics (daytime and late-night host for NBC) *2008 Summer Olympics (daytime host for NBC) ==References== Category:1949 births Category:Living people Category:Tennis broadcasters Category:Motorsports broadcasters Category:College basketball broadcasters Category:Olympic Games broadcasters Category:National Football League broadcasters Category:Golf broadcasters Category:College football broadcasters Category:Major League Baseball broadcasters Category:Boxing broadcasters Category:American television news anchors Category:American Emmy Award winners Category:American bloggers
title: Jim Lampley
